meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inextricable.
meanings.sent1: The inextricabilities of the situation left us confused.
meanings.sent2: The detective faced the inextricabilities of the case with determination.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve the puzzle of inextricabilities in the story was like finding a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent4: The inextricabilities of human emotions can sometimes be more complex than solving a riddle.
meanings.sent5: The inextricabilities of the maze made it nearly impossible to find the exit.

meanings.definition: The condition of being impossible to disentangle or separate.
meanings.sent1: The inextricabilities of the knot made it impossible to untangle.
meanings.sent2: The inextricabilities of the relationship were causing tension between them.
meanings.sent3: Trying to separate the inextricabilities of the intertwined wires was like trying to separate two inseparable friends.
meanings.sent4: The inextricabilities of the problem seemed like a web that kept getting more tangled.
meanings.sent5: The inextricabilities of the vines made it challenging to clear the path in the jungle.
